definition: lit. cuts and bruises all over (idiom); fig. totally refuted
body/form/style/system/substance/to experience/aspect (linguistics)
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
to finish/to be over/whole/complete/entire
skin

sentences.english: Critics have come out on all sides of Bernanke's highly accommodative monetary policy.
sentences.chinese: 伯南克高度宽松的货币政策已然被批评地体无完肤。

sentences.english: This sarcasm knocked the speaker's argument info a cocked hat.
sentences.chinese: 这种讽刺话把讲话人的论点驳得体无完肤。

sentences.english: Rely on can make people happy but it can also make you hurt injured all over the body.
sentences.chinese: 依赖可以让人幸福但它也可以把你伤的体无完肤。

sentences.english: The president's new policy was taken to pieces by the opposite.
sentences.chinese: 反对派把总统的新政策批得体无完肤。

sentences.english: Thank you for hurting me let me see the Qingxudong injured all over the body, false love.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢你伤到我体无完肤，让我看清虚假的爱情。

sentences.english: This fallacy has long since been torn to shreds.
sentences.chinese: 这种谬论早已被批得体无完肤。

sentences.english: Towards evening, pig be a nass of bruises is brought back piggery.
sentences.chinese: 傍晚，猪体无完肤被带回猪圈。

sentences.english: His latest novel was cut up by the reviewers.
sentences.chinese: 他的最新小说被评论家批得体无完肤。

sentences.english: The Prime Minister made mincemeat of his opponent's arguments.
sentences.chinese: 首相把对方反对他的论点驳得体无完肤。
劳拉幸存下来了，但却体无完肤。

sentences.english: We get devastated and start reminiscing the past happy time.
sentences.chinese: 我们被打击的体无完肤然后开始回想过去的美好。
